oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SHORELINE CHANGE PROJECTION CONSIDERING THE UNCERTAINTY CAUSED BY MULTIPLE FACTORS UNDER CLIMATE CHANGE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Watanabe, Kunihiro
Kato, Fuminori
Katano, Akiyoshi
Tanaka, Yoji
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Climate change adaptation represents a critical challenge in contemporary beach management. While the majority of previous researches has concentrated on erosion caused by sea level rise, the effects of future change in wave conditions and storm surges have not been sufficiently explored. To address this, we have developed a new method for projecting shoreline changes, which allows for the simultaneous calculation of changes induced by sea level rise and longshore sand transport. Subsequently, we have conducted parametric studies to assess the influence of multiple variables on future shoreline changes, and demonstrated the importance of accurate estimation of sediment supply from rivers.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 38 (2024): Proceedings of 38th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Rome, Italy, 2024; papers.49
